com.jswiff.io
Class InputBitStream

java.lang.Object
  com.jswiff.io.InputBitStream
public final class InputBitStream
extends java.lang.Object

Implements a bit stream used for reading SWF files.

Constructor Summary
InputBitStream(byte[] buffer)
          Creates a new bit stream instance.
InputBitStream(java.io.InputStream stream)
          Creates a new bit stream instance from a given input stream.
 
Method Summary

          Byte align, i.e. after invocation, data is read beginning at the following byte boundary.

          Closes the internal stream.

          Enables stream compression (ZLIB).

          Returns the stream offset, i.e. the number of bytes (fully) read.

Constructor Detail

InputBitStream

public InputBitStream(byte[] buffer)
Creates a new bit stream instance. Data is read from a given byte buffer.

Parameters:
buffer - data buffer the bit stream reads from

InputBitStream

public InputBitStream(java.io.InputStream stream)
Creates a new bit stream instance from a given input stream.

Parameters:
stream - the internal input stream the data is read from.
Method Detail

align

public void align()
Byte align, i.e. after invocation, data is read beginning at the following byte boundary. Has no effect if cursor is already at a byte boundary.

available

public int available()
              throws java.io.IOException
Returns the number of bytes that can be read from the internal input stream without blocking. This value is obtained by invoking available() on the internal stream. Don't use this method on compressed streams.

Returns:
the number of bytes that can be read without blocking
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error has occurred
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if stream is compressed

close

public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
Closes the internal stream. After this, data cannot be read anymore.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error has occurred

enableCompression

public void enableCompression()
Enables stream compression (ZLIB).

getOffset

public long getOffset()
Returns the stream offset, i.e. the number of bytes (fully) read.

Returns:
the stream offset

isANSI

public boolean isANSI()
Checks whether ANSI encoding is to be used when decoding strings.

Returns:
true for ANSI encoding

isShiftJIS

public boolean isShiftJIS()
Checks whether Shift-JIS encoding is to be used when decoding strings.

Returns:
true for Shift-JIS encoding

move

public void move(long delta)
          throws java.io.IOException
Move within the stream, relative to the current position.

Parameters:
delta - positive to move forward, negative for backward move
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error has occured

readBooleanBit

public boolean readBooleanBit()
                       throws java.io.IOException
Reads a bit and interprets it as boolean.

Returns:
true for 1, false for 0
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error has occurred

public float readFloat16()
                  throws java.io.IOException
Reads a 16 bit floating point number (half precision, or s10e5, i.e. 1 sign bit, 5 exponent bits and 10 mantissa bits).

Returns:
